definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: dip (NH id.; Aram. [[טְבַל]] dip, bathe; cf. perh. Ar. t.amala saturavit tinctura vestem, Frey)—

definitions.title: Qal
definitions.body: Pf. [[וְטָבַל]] consec. Le 4:6 + 5 t.; [[וְטָבַלְתְּ]] consec. Ru 2:14; [[וּטְבַלְתֶּם]] consec. Ex 12:22; Impf. [[וַיִּטְבּׂל]] Le 9:9 + 3 t.; 2 ms. sf. [[תִּטְבְּלֵנִי]] Job 9:31; [[וַיִּטְבְּלוּ]] Ge 37:31—dip:

trans., dip a thing in, c. acc. rei + [[בְּ]]: in blood Ge 37:31 (J), so esp. in connexion with sacrifices Le 4:6, Le 9:9, Le 14:6, Le 14:51 (also in fresh water); in water, for purification Nu 19:18 (all P); of dipping rod in honey 1Sa 14:27, bread in vinegar Ru 2:24, foot in oil De 33:24 (poem); [[בַּשַּׁחַת תִּטְבְּלֵנִי]] Job 9:31 in the ditch dost thou dip me; acc. omitted Ex 12:22 (JE; in blood), 2Ki 8:15 (in water); but also + [[מִן]] = moisten with, with some of Le 4:17 (blood), Le 14:16 (oil).
intrans., dip (oneself), sq. [[בְּ]], 2Ki 5:14 in Jordan (‖[[רָחַץ בְּ]] v:2Ki 5:10; v:2Ki 5:12).
